tweets.text: There is absolutely no inevitability if you are willing to consider what is happening.
“The artist is always engaged in writing a detailed history of the future because he is the only person aware of the nature of the present.” – Wyndham Lewis
Mud sometimes gives the illusion of depth.
The more that is publicly recorded about the actual existence of any person, the more (s)he is diminished in (her) his private existence… (s)he becomes the admirers of (her) his recordings.
The net effect of speedup is slowdown.
The bias of each medium of communication is far more distorting than the deliberate lie.
The new media are not bridges between man and nature—they are nature.
We live decades ahead of our thinking.
The more you make people alike, the more competition you have. Competition is based on the principle of absolute conformity.
Any minute, trite bit of news acquires infinite potential at the speed of electricity. Any trivial thing can become momentous.
Nothing could be further from the spirit of new technology than “a place for everything and everything in its place.”
Let us keep in mind that the new reality is in the image and not behind it.
In one era, and out the other.

The real use of the computer is not to reduce staff or cut costs, or to speed up or smooth out anything that has been going on. Its true function is to program and orchestrate terrestrial and galactic environments and energies in a harmonious way.
The effects of technology do not occur at the level of opinions or concepts, but alter sense ratios or patterns of perception steadily and without any resistance.
Any understanding of social and cultural change is impossible without a knowledge of the way media works as environments.

Any medium exerts its most potent effect by changing the form, scale, and speed of human relations and activities.
A medium is not neutral — it does something to people. It takes hold of them. It rubs them off, it massages them, it bumps them around.

The fragmentariness of personal experience creates problems at an accelerating rate.
